comments: Very concerned about traffic congestion during construction. Main Street is already backed up during rush hour.
Property values will decline if construction takes 2 years. What compensation is available?
When will construction start? Need more information about timeline.
Support this project! We desperately need better transit access in this neighborhood.
Noise from construction will be unacceptable for residents. What are the noise mitigation measures?
My business relies on street parking. Will parking be available during construction?
Worried about pedestrian safety during construction. How will you maintain sidewalks?
This is a great opportunity to improve our community. Fully support the transit station.
Concerned about dust and air quality impacts. Do you have environmental monitoring planned?
Traffic on Oak Avenue is already terrible. This will make it worse.
Property assessments will go up because of the station. Will taxes increase?
Need better bike access to the station. Current bike lanes are inadequate.
Construction noise will disrupt my home office. Can you limit hours to evenings only?
How will emergency vehicles access our street during construction?
Support the project but concerned about gentrification and displacement of long-time residents.
My elderly mother lives on Main Street. She is worried about vibration damage to her house.
When will you provide written updates? Need regular communication.
Business customers won't be able to find parking. This will destroy my business.
Excited about improved transit access! This will help people get to work.
Worried about crime and safety at the station after it opens. What security measures?
Construction trucks should not use residential streets. Use the highway route instead.
Property values near transit usually increase. This is good for homeowners.
How will you maintain access to the medical clinic during construction?
Concerned about tree removal. Will you replace trees after construction?
Support this project. Better transit means less traffic and pollution.
Noise barriers should be installed before construction starts.
My business is already struggling. Cannot afford revenue loss during construction.
What compensation for businesses affected by construction?
Traffic study is incomplete. Did you consider peak hours on Fridays?
Wheelchair access to the station is essential. Current plans look inadequate.
Support improved transit but opposed to high-rise development near station.
Construction vibration could damage historic building at 456 Main Street.
Need protected bike lanes connecting to the station.
How will you handle snow removal and winter access during construction?
Property owners should receive compensation for loss of street parking.
This project will bring jobs and economic development to the area.
Concerned about loss of neighborhood character with transit-oriented development.
Traffic management plan is insufficient. Need traffic police during peak hours.
Support the station but need guarantees about noise limits after opening.
Will there be public art at the station? This is important for community identity.
My rental tenants are worried about construction noise. May lose tenants.
How will deliveries to businesses be maintained during construction?
Excited about this project! Finally investing in our neighborhood.
Concerned about rodent problems during excavation. What pest control measures?
Traffic detours will confuse drivers and cause accidents.
Support better transit access. Climate change requires us to reduce car use.
Property value impacts need independent assessment, not developer-funded study.
Construction hours should be limited to 9am-3pm to avoid rush hour.
How will you compensate homeowners for property damage from vibration?
Station design looks ugly. Need better architecture that fits neighborhood.
Parking at the station is insufficient. Need at least 200 spaces for park-and-ride.
Support this project. Will reduce traffic and improve air quality.
Concerned about light pollution from station at night.
Business liaison is needed to coordinate with affected businesses weekly.
How will you handle utility disruptions during construction?
Worried about basement flooding from changed drainage patterns.
Support the transit station but construction timeline is too aggressive.
Need community benefits agreement to ensure local hiring.
Traffic study assumptions are wrong. Need new study during school year.
Will there be accessible washrooms at the station?
Concerned about increased crime and loitering near station.
Support project if you commit to maintaining tree canopy.
Construction staging area should not be in residential neighborhood.
How will you manage construction traffic on narrow streets?
Excited for transit improvements! Long overdue investment.
Worried about impact on property insurance rates during construction.
Will station have weather protection and heated shelters?
Need dedicated bus lane to make transit competitive with driving.
Concerned about lack of affordable housing near station.
Support the project but timeline conflicts with school construction.
Will you provide advance notice of road closures?
Noise monitoring should be done by independent third party.
My property value has already declined because of uncertainty.
Support improved transit but need parking enforcement at station.
How will construction affect commute times on Main Street?
Concerned about loss of green space for station construction.
This station will transform our neighborhood for the better.
Need guarantees about air quality monitoring during construction.
Will local businesses get preference for construction contracts?
Worried about safety of children walking to school during construction.
Support better transit. Essential for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Construction should be phased to maintain at least one lane of traffic.
How will you address concerns about gentrification?
Need community input on station design and public art.
Concerned about impact on septic systems from vibration.
Support this project wholeheartedly. Best thing for our community.
